quest.name: Who Wards the Warders?
journal: Themis would offer what comfort he can to Erichthonios.

Although Themis respects that Erichthonios may need space after recent events, he is also eager to get the investigation back on track. He suggests lending an ear to Erichthonios's troubles, hoping to give the warder a chance to air his doubts and misgivings.

Erichthonios reveals his fraught past with Lahabrea, his father. Although the gaoler learned the art of shackles from said man, there is little else connecting father and son, and when Erichthonios's mother─previous chief warden of Pandæmonium─passed away, Lahabrea assumed her position with characteristic stoicism. Although there is surely more to the story, Erichthonios changes the subject to Hesperos and the battle ahead. After some discussion, you decide that he should be tracked down with the utmost haste and sealed away with interment magicks, that he might be questioned and his motives made clear. Although Hesperos's mastery of creation magicks means that you must face him in an unfavorable battle, hope ever remains in your heart.

※Asphodelos: The Fourth Circle can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

Hesperos throws every devious trick he can─along with no small amount of theatrics─at you and your band of illusive heroes, but eventually he falls before your combined might. All that remains is to inter him with the selfsame magic he once held dominion over...

Your hopes to detain Hesperos for questioning are thwarted when he brings an end to his own life, his essence and secrets returning to the star. While this leaves many questions unanswered, Erichthonios is eager to begin rescuing his colleagues and the subjects he is charged with safekeeping. Themis takes control of Asphodelos, but as he does, he senses a presence from deeper within the facility─and no sooner does he inform you of this discovery than a ward appears to block your way forward. Stymied, Themis suggests withdrawing for now, that he might better gauge this new threat.

With room to think, Themis concludes that Hesperos was not the one behind the chaos in Pandæmonium, and suggests that the true mastermind is hiding deeper underground. To progress further, however, you must find a way to surpass the obstruction blocking the entrance to Abyssos, a feat which may take some time. Themis and Erichthonios encourage you to rest until you are needed once more, and perhaps in the meantime return to Aporia to apprise Professor Claudien of your exploits.

Claudien listens to your report on the events in Elpis with both interest and growing concern. He seems convinced that your success in the past is crucial to maintaining the present, and assures you that his team will devote their every effort to aid you. You return the crystal to him so that they can continue their research into its origins, and as your allies in the past have also done, he suggests that you catch some well-earned rest until further developments occur.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Please...leave me be.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Much as I am loath to disturb Erichthonios so soon after what just occurred, I am afraid circumstances do not afford us the luxury of time.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Perhaps it will do him well to speak about recent events. Concerning both the keyward...and his father.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: He seemed reticent to say aught concerning Lahabrea when the subject was broached. Doubtless his relationship with his father is a fraught one.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: The creation of the ward which surrounds Pandæmonium was an astounding feat of magical prowess. A feat accomplished by none other than Lahabrea...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: That both my father and I can bind others in chains is perhaps the only thing that we have in common.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Ah, so it is true.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Aye, I'm Lahabrea's son. Bereft of his talent for magicks or his brilliant mind, but his son nonetheless. Surely this doesn't come entirely as a surprise to you.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Nay... I had an inkling when you said you had practiced aetherial shackles since childhood. Assuming you haven't been employed here quite that long, it had to indicate some long-held connection with Lahabrea.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: 'Twas Lahabrea that taught me how to cast aetherial shackles, but that was it. My further education was overseen by the Words of Lahabrea─more specifically my mother, who was a researcher there.

dialogue.name: ETHEMIS
dialogue.text: You did speak of Athena, chief keyward before Lahabrea. She is your mother, yes?

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: How astute. I can see now why you were chosen to lead this investigation.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: You've the right of it. Athena was my mother, and it was she who invited me to join her here. Lahabrea had nothing to do with it.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I see there is little love lost between you two. What I cannot see is why Lahabrea was appointed chief keyward when another was already in place.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...Was in place. My mother is no longer with us.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: And Lahabrea was all too eager to assume her responsibilities, with nary a moment spared to mourn her. What love do I owe him now, when he offered not one drop of compassion then?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Ah...I see. “She is no longer with us.” An expression to convey the end of a life.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I have known only the public face of Lahabrea. While he is lauded for his ability to maintain composure in the face of unnerving circumstances, I must admit that oft he comes across as...cold.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...Apologies, but can we speak of something else? This topic isn't an easy one for me to discuss...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Of course. There are more pressing matters at hand, after all. Namely, how to deal with Hesperos.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: We have yet to see the other warders. Judging by what we know, we can surmise that Hesperos has confined them somewhere beyond our grasp.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: And now that he is aware of our presence, he will be preparing for our next encounter. We cannot expect to face him on equal footing. Quite the opposite, in fact.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Every moment we spend chasing after the creations is another moment Hesperos can contrive another advantage for himself. The wisest course would be to find him first and foremost.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: He said that he has become one with the creations...perhaps that means he is vulnerable to interment?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: In theory, that should be possible. However, is it enough merely to confine him? After all he has done?

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I need to know why. I need to know what drove him to forsake everything he's worked for.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Was it all truly so that he could serve his master? To my mind, he's merely put Lahabrea's own work at risk in trade for some nebulous power.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Lahabrea is the chief keyward of Pandæmonium─how would throwing it into disarray win his favor? It doesn't make any sense...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I share your curiosity, but we must consider that our enemy has us at a disadvantage in every sense. ...What do you think? Should we seek to put him in fetters, or would it be too dangerous to allow him quarter?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I want answers too.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If you fail to confine him, I can always strike him down.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Daring as ever, I see. I know not which trials you have faced in your past, but to see you so certain is all the convincing I need. Very well, let us try Erichthonios's plan.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I believe I can shed some light on the nature of our foe. When Hesperos spoke with us, I noticed he bore the telltale fangs of the vrykolakas, a beast which feeds off the aether of its prey. Likely that is the creation Hesperos merged his essence with.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: And we know all too well that he can change the environment around himself at will. The battle will not be an easy one, but I believe in our victory.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: That Hesperos possessed such a lust for power that he would resort to this... Clearly I misjudged him. I'd like nothing more than to strike him down myself, but seeing you wipe that arrogant grin off his face will taste just as sweet.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: He called himself a hemitheos, and claimed immortality. I know not how he discovered this dark art, but his actions do not bespeak a sound mind.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Now, Themis. We end this here!

dialogue.name: HESPEROS
dialogue.text: Fools... I will not be put in chains...

dialogue.name: HESPEROS
dialogue.text: To think that I would fall before one such as you. Perhaps I should have treated you as more than a mere nuisance.

dialogue.name: HESPEROS
dialogue.text: Despite your victory, you shall never have the knowledge you seek. The secrets of my transformation, the secrets of my deception─they shall return to the star with me!

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: You are wasting your breath, Hesperos. We have the upper hand now, surely you can see that.

dialogue.name: HESPEROS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes. My repertoire is not exhausted yet, however... Although I have failed, my end shall be on my terms.

dialogue.name: HESPEROS
dialogue.text: I remain loyal to my very last... Come what may, I die...with dignity...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...How did your ambition lead you so astray, Hesperos? You were better than that.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Your star shone more brightly than any other in Pandæmonium. You had Lahabrea's respect, his trust─what more did you seek? That you would forsake all that, and sully your legacy besides...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: He became so blinded by his own desires that he lost sight of his duty. In the end, he lost everything, and his plans lie in tatters. I fail to see any dignity in that.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Even so, I would have liked to know why he chose this path.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Hesperos's infatuation with your father was his undoing. Perhaps he was jealous that fate had chosen you, and not him, to be Lahabrea's son. So terrible did this jealousy become that he sought verboten power─power that Lahabrea would be unable to ignore.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: How does a pursuit for respect warp one's heart so? How does infatuation with one person turn into contempt for everyone else? I've never heard of such a thing.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's not as uncommon as you might think.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: It happens, but that doesn't mean it's right.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I see... I admit I cannot but find it vexing, but perhaps that signifies naught but my own capacity for bitterness...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: I do understand what it is to have a beacon to follow in dark times─a person you trust to guide you true. How it is to desperately wish their light would fall upon you again.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: ...But we have spent enough time assuming the intentions of the departed─there are the living to consider. We must find the other warders and round up the remaining creations forthwith. Of that, at least, we can be certain.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I believe I can be of help in that matter.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: The influence of Hesperos's magic is fading throughout Asphodelos. Now is the perfect opportunity to seize control of the facilities and restore things to their original state.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Seize control...? Can you really do that?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: What!? What is this presence?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Erichthonios. What lies beyond that threshold?

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: That's the passage which connects Asphodelos to Abyssos. Why?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Be on your guard, you two.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Now that Asphodelos is free of obstructions, I can more easily sense disturbances in the lower levels. Something stirs in Abyssos!

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: A warding sigil? How!?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Let us return to the gates for now. I should like to appraise the situation from there.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Needless to say, our investigation is far from over.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Just when I had thought our work to be done... Did this tragedy unfold all throughout Pandæmonium?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Although we have defeated Hesperos, it appears we have but scratched the surface of Pandæmonium's troubles.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: My head is still swimming with questions, but could this mean that Hesperos wasn't actually behind this?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: It is a stark possibility, yes. The root of this crisis may lie somewhere much deeper than even Abyssos.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: When we first encountered you, you said the memories of your escape were vague and that your senses were muddled. I believe this was more than the result of a panicked mind─you were made to feel this way by a powerful magical influence.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: It is possible that this same magic could have poisoned Hesperos's heart, twisting his affection for Lahabrea into a burning obsession. Then, in his altered state, he was made an offer of power he could not refuse...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Wait... Are you suggesting that someone else turned Hesperos into that...thing? If so, it stands to reason that they wouldn't stop at him...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Indeed. Our mysterious mastermind does not lack for subjects for his experiments. For more potential hemitheoi.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: If what you're saying is true, then my colleagues...they're doomed to share the same fate as Hesperos.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Do not lose heart yet, Erichthonios. Hesperos challenged us alone, and that tells me that the process of his creation was a long and taxing one. If he was the first hemitheos, then the rest of the warders are likely still alive.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: However, much as I would like to hasten deeper into Pandæmonium, the way forward is sealed off. We must focus our efforts on finding a way through.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: With the creations still having free rein of Asphodelos, that won't be easy...

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: On the contrary, I yet retain control of these circles, and thus can wield interment magick within their halls at will. The creatures will pose no threat to us.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Just like that!? Then nothing's stopping us from returning order to Asphodelos.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Just so. I shall require your expertise to keep the peace after the subjects have been returned to their confinement, however. You are Asphodelos's sole remaining warder, after all.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I did not expect this investigation to become so involved. Of course, I would like to resolve matters here without resorting to outside help, but...

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Do you mean to send a report to Lahabrea?

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: 'Tis too soon to say. Let us first find a way into Abyssos. It would be best to withhold our judgment until we have ascertained the whereabouts of the other warders and the identity of the party responsible for their disappearance.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Agreed. Even so, if it means saving even a single life within Pandæmonium, then I'm not above asking Lahabrea for help...should it come to that.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Recent discoveries certainly paint Hesperos's actions in a new light... The number of unknown elements in this investigation grows, and we must proceed forward with the utmost caution.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: To that end, Erichthonios and I shall remain here for the time being. Much as I enjoy your company, I do not believe we shall be needing protection so long as we remain in Asphodelos.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: You should take this time to rest. Surely you are weary, and there may be more battles ahead of us. Themis's burden may grow heavier in your absence, but he's shown that he's more than capable to bear it.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Still, I would help wheresoever I'm able. All we've achieved so far has been thanks to you two, and I mean to repay the debt I owe. I don't know what use I can be outside of placating the creatures, but I'll find a way.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Nonsense, you owe us nothing. It was thanks to your knowledge of the magicks which govern this place that we were able to come this far. Elsewise we would have likely succumbed to the hippokampos's assault.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Each of us has arrived at this dire pass by separate paths, but it is only by combining our respective expertise that we will reach the end of it and see Pandæmonium saved.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Thank you, Themis. Hesperos's words seem to have affected me more than I realize. Together we've come this far, and together we'll reach the end.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: I have no doubt we will. Even so, let us allow Forename herhis rest.

dialogue.name: THEMIS
dialogue.text: Besides, you have someone awaiting a report on your progress, yes? I daresay your story will be much more than they ever imagined.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: Ah, so you don't serve the Convocation. I suppose I needn't worry about you going behind our backs to curry favor with Lahabrea.

dialogue.name: ERICHTHONIOS
dialogue.text: My friend would be very curious to hear what has occurred here. However, I fear that if I left Pandæmonium, the wards protecting it would quickly deteriorate. I hope shehe does not mind assuming some of my duties in the meantime.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: At the professor's behest, we have kept our reports on recent events as vague as we can manage. Even if we wished to do otherwise, not much of note has transpired here as of late...

dialogue.name: RUISSENAUD
dialogue.text: Professor Claudien has tasked me with recording the aetherial signatures of each and every crystal in his recent orders. As a lowly assistant, I'm honored to be given such an enormous and monumental assignment!

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Welcome, Forename! Back from the past none the worse for wear, I see. So, what did you find?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: So there is evil afoot in Pandæmonium─an already ominous place, I must say. Mythic beasts and missing warders... Truly, we are fortunate to see you returned to us in one piece.

dialogue.name: NEMJIJI
dialogue.text: It appears the voice Forename heard from the crystal spoke the truth. As for who left it behind, and why, those are yet questions to be answered.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Indeed. It could be someone who lived among the ancients, or it could be someone trying to avert a tragedy from the future. Much remains shrouded in mystery.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Yet ilm by ilm, we shall unveil that mystery. With the help of Forename, of course! By herhis actions was the fabric of the past reshaped, yet shehe returns to the same present shehe left.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Which can only mean one thing: that herhis intervention in Pandæmonium's crisis is but one of the countless building blocks of history upon which our present has been built.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: There is no telling what consequences would arise if we stopped pursuing this matter now. Whatever plot is unraveling within Pandæmonium, we must not let it reach its conclusion. If one of those creatures should escape, what ripples would carry forth to the future?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: They might wreak havoc upon the world of the ancients, and their despair would leave an indelible mark upon history's pages. That despair would only feed the terrible beasts that arose during the Final Days.

dialogue.name: RUISSENAUD
dialogue.text: The first Final Days already had a drastic effect on the eons that followed. If the scars it left were made even deeper, then we risk losing our present entirely...

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Whatever the cost, our connection with the future of Elpis must be preserved. I know I have asked much of you already, but can I count on you to continue your work in Pandæmonium?

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Your tireless efforts are much appreciated. If there is aught we can do to ease your burden, you need only say the word.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, might you return the crystal into our keeping? While we cannot accompany you to the past, perhaps something can be gained by researching it further.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Ah, it shines just as splendidly as the day we met! We shall begin work right away, but I cannot promise any meaningful results for some time. And as matters in Elpis seem to be in a similar state, I must ask that you rest.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: But before that, allow me to make an introduction. As our research moves into its critical stage, I found it only suitable to recruit another assistant.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Mylenie is an expert in armaments from throughout history, be they from the far-flung past or made in the most modern forges. Should you find aught of interest in your adventures, bring it here and she will be glad to offer her services.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: We know researchers in numerous fields that would love to get their hands on artifacts from bygone eras, and would give you goods in return that should aid you in trials ahead.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: Furthermore, if you ever wish to peruse the records of events you have reported here, Nemjiji has been taking faithful and thorough notes. She is at your complete disposal.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: ...I sense that we have embarked upon something monumental. Something that will dwarf all else I have accomplished in my many years of research.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: I can think of no greater honor, nor reassurance, than to have your capable assistance in this endeavor. If there is anything to be found that will contribute to your success, we shall find it.

dialogue.name: CLAUDIEN
dialogue.text: We shall not rest until we have unlocked the mysteries of this crystal! And you will be the first to know when we do.
